required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immune Response In Children Revaccinated With Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine
clinical_study.official_title: Revaccination With Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine - Characterization Of The Immune Response After Polysaccharide

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate the immune response to 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnCV) in children who as infants received either a complete series of PnCV versus a combination of PnCV and pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine (PSV). This study is also intended to evaluate the safety of the 13vPnC.

detailed_description.textblock: Follow-up measure for the EMEA supporting a Type II variation for Prevenar (PCV7) label

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Predefined Serotype-specific Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Antibody Concentration Greater Than or Equal to ( ≥) 0.35 Micrograms Per Milliliter (Mcg/mL) Measured 1 Month After Vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold ≥ 0.35 mcg/mL along with the corresponding 95 percent (%) Confidence Interval (CI) for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented. Exact 2-sided CI based on the observed proportion of participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Opsonophagocytic Assay (OPA) Titers ≥ 1:8 Measured 1 Month After Vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving OPA along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented. Exact 2-sided CI based on the observed proportion of participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Response Measured 1 Month After Vaccination (Avidity Assay)
secondary_outcome.description: Avidity assay had measurable range of 0.117 to 7.5. Results expressed as avidity index (AI). Geometric mean avidity presented for 3 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotype 6B, 19F, and 23F) and 2 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1 and 5).

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Response Measured 1 Month After Vaccination (OPA)
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody response as measured by OPA, 1 month after vaccination. Geometric mean titers (GMTs) calculated using all participants with available data for the specified blood draw. CIs were back transformations of a CI based on the Student t distribution for the mean logarithm of the titers.

arm_group.description: All subjects will receive a single dose of 13vPnC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Fully vaccinated children who participated in a previous Wyeth study (Study D139-P506) and received a booster dose of either 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine (PPV23) or pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PnCV) per the original protocol for that study.
- Subjects must be in good health as determined by medical history, physical examination and clinical judgment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergy to any component of the 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) or 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC).
- History of documented invasive pneumococcal disease (defined as a positive culture of S. pneumoniae from a normally sterile body site).
- Any known or suspected disease or dysfunction of the immune system, including: HIV infection, Malignancy, Receipt of immunosuppressive therapy, Sickle cell hemoglobinopathy.
- Receipt of immune-globulin within the past 3 months.
- Receipt of either PSV or 7vPnCV since the completion of Study D139-P506.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: PCV/23vPS/13vPnC
group.description: For this study, participants received a single dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC). Participants previously must have also received an infant series of 9-valent pneumococcal-conjugate-meningococcal serogroup C conjugate combination vaccine (9V-MnCC) also known as pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV) followed by a toddler dose of 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine (23vPS).

group.title: PCV/PCV/13vPnC
group.description: For this study, participants received a single dose of 13vPnC. Participants must have also previously received 9V-MnCC followed by a toddler dose of 9V-MnCC (also referred to as PCV).

group.title: PCV/23vPS/13vPnC
group.description: For this study, participants received a single dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC). Participants previously must have also received an infant series of 9-valent pneumococcal-conjugate-meningococcal serogroup C conjugate combination vaccine (9V-MnCC) also known as pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV) followed by a toddler dose of 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine (23vPS).

group.description: For this study, participants received a single dose of 13vPnC. Participants must have also previously received 9V-MnCC followed by a toddler dose of 9V-MnCC (also referred to as PCV).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Predefined Serotype-specific Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Antibody Concentration Greater Than or Equal to ( ≥) 0.35 Micrograms Per Milliliter (Mcg/mL) Measured 1 Month After Vaccination
outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold ≥ 0.35 mcg/mL along with the corresponding 95 percent (%) Confidence Interval (CI) for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented. Exact 2-sided CI based on the observed proportion of participants.
outcome.population: Evaluable Immunogenicity Population: received 1 dose of 13vPnC at Visit 1, blood drawn within specified timeframes, at least 1 valid and determinate assay result at Visits 1 and 3, no major protocol violations, and no prohibited vaccines. N=number of participants with a determinate IgG antibody concentration to the given serotype.

outcome.title: Antibody Response Measured 1 Month After Vaccination (Avidity Assay)
outcome.description: Avidity assay had measurable range of 0.117 to 7.5. Results expressed as avidity index (AI). Geometric mean avidity presented for 3 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotype 6B, 19F, and 23F) and 2 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1 and 5).
outcome.population: Evaluable Immunogenicity Population; In accordance with the recommendation of the lab completing the assays, values above the upper limit were assigned a value of 8.0 and those below the lower limit were assigned a value of 0.10. N=number of participants with a determinate avidity index for the specified serotype.

measure.population: Evaluable Immunogenicity Population; In accordance with the recommendation of the lab completing the assays, values above the upper limit were assigned a value of 8.0 and those below the lower limit were assigned a value of 0.10. analysis.groups_desc: Serotype 1: Ratio of geometric mean avidity (PCV/23vPS/13vPnC, PCV/PCV/13vPnC).
analysis.estimate_desc: CIs for the ratio were back transformations of a CI based on the Student t distribution for the mean difference of the logarithms of the measures (PCV/23vPS/13vPnC, PCV/PCV/13vPnC).

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Concentration (GMC) for Serotype-specific Pneumococcal IgG Antibody 1 Month After Vaccination
outcome.description: Antibody GMC as measured by mcg/mL for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented. GMC (13vPnC) and corresponding 2-sided 95% CIs were evaluated. CIs were back transformations of a CI based on the Student t distribution for the mean logarithm of the concentrations. GMCs were calculated using all particpants with available data for the specified blood draw.
outcome.population: Evaluable Immunogenicity Population; N=number of participants with a determinate antibody concentration to the specified serotype.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Prespecified Local Reactions Within 4 Days of Vaccination
outcome.description: Local reactions were reported by the parent/legal guardian using a diary card. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Redness and swelling were scaled as Any (redness or swelling present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (> 7.0 cm). Particpants may have been represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.population: Safety Population: all participants who receive at least 1 dose of the study vaccine; N=number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days; n=number of participants reporting the specific characteristic

group.title: PCV/23vPS/13vPnC
group.description: For this study, participants received a single dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC). Participants previously must have also received an infant series of 9-valent pneumococcal-conjugate-meningococcal serogroup C conjugate combination vaccine (9V-MnCC) also known as pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV) followed by a toddler dose of 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine (23vPS).

group.title: PCV/PCV/13vPnC
group.description: For this study, participants received a single dose of 13vPnC. Participants must have also previously received 9V-MnCC followed by a toddler dose of 9V-MnCC (also referred to as PCV).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Prespecified Local Reactions Within 4 Days of Vaccination
measure.description: Local reactions were reported by the parent/legal guardian using a diary card. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Redness and swelling were scaled as Any (redness or swelling present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (> 7.0 cm). Particpants may have been represented in more than 1 category.
measure.population: Safety Population: all participants who receive at least 1 dose of the study vaccine; N=number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days; n=number of participants reporting the specific characteristic

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison between treatments for any tenderness
Comparison between treatments for significant tenderness
Comparison between treatments for any redness
Comparison between treatments for mild redness
Comparison between treatments for moderate redness
Comparison between treatments for severe redness
Comparison between treatments for any swelling
Comparison between treatments for mild swelling
Comparison between treatments for moderate swelling
Comparison between treatments for severe swelling

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Prespecified Systemic Reactions Within 4 Days of Vaccination
outcome.description: Pre-specified systemic events (any fever 38 degrees Celsius [C], decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, and decreased sleep) were reported using a diary card. Participants may have been represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.population: Safety; N=number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days; n=number of participants reporting the specific characteristic

group.title: PCV/23vPS/13vPnC
group.description: For this study, participants received a single dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC). Participants previously must have also received an infant series of 9-valent pneumococcal-conjugate-meningococcal serogroup C conjugate combination vaccine (9V-MnCC) also known as pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV) followed by a toddler dose of 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine (23vPS).

group.title: PCV/PCV/13vPnC
group.description: For this study, participants received a single dose of 13vPnC. Participants must have also previously received 9V-MnCC followed by a toddler dose of 9V-MnCC (also referred to as PCV).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Prespecified Systemic Reactions Within 4 Days of Vaccination
measure.description: Pre-specified systemic events (any fever 38 degrees Celsius [C], decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, and decreased sleep) were reported using a diary card. Participants may have been represented in more than 1 category.
measure.population: Safety; N=number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days; n=number of participants reporting the specific characteristic

class.title: Fever ≥ 38 degrees C but ≤ 39 degrees C (n=1,1)

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison between treatments for fever ≥ 38 degrees C but ≤ 39 degrees C
Comparison between treatments for decreased appetite
Comparison between treatments for irritability
Comparison between treatments for increased sleep
Comparison between treatments for decreased sleep
Comparison between treatments for rash

reported_events.time_frame: Baseline through 1 Month after last study vaccination (28 Days). Local reactions and systemic events assessed within 4 days of dose (Day 1 through Day 4)
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an adverse event (AE) and a Serious AE (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: PCV/23vPS/13vPnC
group.description: For this study, participants received a single dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC). Participants previously must have also received an infant series of 9-valent pneumococcal-conjugate-meningococcal serogroup C conjugate combination vaccine (9V-MnCC) also known as pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV) followed by a toddler dose of 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine (23vPS). Other AEs (non-serious events): the number affected (N) for nonsystematic (unsolicited) Other Adverse Events N=8; systematic (solicited) Local Reactions N=44; systematic (solicited) Systemic Events N=9.

group.title: PCV/PCV/13vPnC
group.description: For this study, participants received a single dose of 13vPnC. Participants must have also previously received 9V-MnCC followed by a toddler dose of 9V-MnCC (also referred to as PCV). Other AEs (non-serious events): the number affected (N) for nonsystematic (unsolicited) Other Adverse Events N=7; systematic (solicited) Local Reactions N=30; systematic (solicited) Systemic Events N=5.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: In protocol, primary analysis based on All Available Immunogenicity Population and later modified to Evaluable Immunogenicity Population in Statistical Analysis Plan based on subsequent similar studies and suitability for primary objective.
